title: How to Use the Bathroom While Camping

steps.headline: Gather toilet paper in a small bag or your pocket.
steps.description: If you have to poop, be sure to take a small shovel with you to bury your waste and go to step 12. Tell your group that you will be back in a few minutes. Hike up to 100' away, or whatever distance you feel gives you enough privacy.

steps.headline: Find a bush, a shrub, or a boulder for added privacy.
steps.description: This is where you are going to pee.

steps.headline: Go behind the bush.
steps.description: You are now looking out into the woods.

steps.headline: Pull your are pants or shorts down to your knees.
steps.description: Hold a skirt up. Tug your underpants halfway to your knees.

steps.headline: Start squatting, and keep looking forward.
steps.description: When you think you are halfway down, stop.

steps.headline: Adjust your underpants, if necessary.
Hold yourself up by one hand.
steps.description: Secure pants or skirt with other.

steps.headline: Squat the rest of the way down.
Begin to urinate.
Wipe with toilet paper or do a shake and wiggle to dry yourself.
steps.description: Pack out your used toilet paper with your garbage, burn it in your camp fire pit, or drop it in your pee spot.

steps.headline: Pull your pants up and go.

steps.description: If you need to defecate, hike 200' out and find a thick tree. Go behind it.

steps.headline: Dig a pit where your waste will fall.
steps.description: This pit should be 6" deep and large enough to poop into.

steps.headline: Face away from the tree and look forward.
steps.description: Pull your pants and underwear down halfway to your knees.

steps.headline: Stick your bum out and over the hole.
Pull your pants down to your knees.
Bend at the waist and at the knees.
Defecate, but don't urinate.
steps.description: You may urinate on your clothing by accident.

steps.headline: Wipe with biodegradable toilet paper or a leaf.
Bury your waste.
